statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Given a sequence of bits (0's and 1's), we want to find an arbitrary monotonically increasing curve (������������)that best fits the bits. That is, the i-th bit is b(i), and we want to find some curve, f, such that for x<y, f(x) <= f(y), and the sum over i of (f(i)-b(i))^2 (the squared error)(����) is minimized.  Given the sequence of bits as a string, return the minimum possible squared error.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
Multiple test cases!
For each case the input contains a string consisting of only 0 and 1 in one line. The bits string will contain between 1 and 200 elements.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each case, output the minimum possible squared error in one line, accurate up to 3 decimal places.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
0.000
0.500

Hint: For example 1, we can make f(1) = 0,   f(2) = 0.
      For example 2, we can make f(1) = 0.5, f(2) = 0.5, f(3) = 1.
